strengths: Maintained positive tone and eye contact
improvements: Reduce filler words like 'um' and 'uh' to improve flow
Structure responses more consistently using the STAR method
Add more quantifiable impact when describing achievements
Slow down slightly when explaining complex ideas

immediate: Practice STAR structure for behavioral answers
Record 5 mock answers and remove filler words
Prepare 3 specific questions about the role/team
longTerm: Join a public-speaking or communication group
Collect metrics for past projects and make a one-page impact summary
Do monthly mock interviews with peers or mentor

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Good morning! Thank you for joining us today. Could you start by telling me a little bit about yourself?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: Good morning! Thank you for having me. I’m a software engineer with around 5 years of experience specializing in frontend development using React, TypeScript, and Node.js. I’ve worked on several scalable products focusing on user experience and performance.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Can you describe a challenging project you worked on recently and how you handled it?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: I led the frontend of an analytics dashboard where large lists caused rendering slowdowns. I implemented virtualization and memoization which cut average load time by 45%. I also added caching for heavy queries and introduced performance tests.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How do you ensure code quality and maintainability?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: We enforce linting, code reviews, and unit/CI tests; I prefer component-driven architecture and documented patterns. For big features we pair program to shorten the feedback loop.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How do you handle tight deadlines?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: Prioritize core functionality, communicate risks, and collaborate with PMs to scope minimal deliverables. I like to break features into small, testable units.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Why do you want to join our company?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: I admire your focus on data-driven product decisions and the chance to help build performant UX at scale. I’m excited by the engineering culture I’ve read about.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: Candidate
transcript.text: Yes — how do cross-functional teams collaborate here? What are the biggest engineering challenges in the next 12 months?

notes.summary: Candidate shows strong technical skills and clear communication. Recommend short-term coaching on answer structure and filler words. Candidate is suitable for next-round technical assessment with minor coaching.
notes.recommendation: Proceed to technical assessment; provide 1 pre-interview coaching session focusing on behavioral structure and pacing.
